title: Discovery: Research Better Cross-Platform Binary Builder
description:
Research and evaluate alternatives to PKG for creating standalone cross-platform binaries. The current evaluation showed that @vercel/ncc doesn't meet our requirements as it only creates Node.js scripts rather than true standalone executables.

**Background:**
- PKG works well but is deprecated and has limitations
- @vercel/ncc was tested but only creates bundled Node.js scripts (not standalone)
- Need a modern, actively maintained solution for true standalone binaries

**Research Areas:**
1. **Modern Binary Builders:**
   - Bun compile (new, promising)
   - Deno compile (established, TypeScript native)
   - Node.js SEA (Single Executable Applications - experimental)
   - nexe (alternative to PKG)
   - pkg alternatives

2. **Evaluation Criteria:**
   - Creates true standalone executables (no Node.js dependency)
   - Cross-platform support (Linux, Windows, macOS)
   - Active maintenance and community
   - Bundle size efficiency
   - Build speed
   - React/Vite compatibility
   - Asset bundling capabilities

3. **Technical Requirements:**
   - Must handle Express server + React frontend
   - Asset extraction and serving
   - JSON file system database compatibility
   - Binary portability (run from any directory)

**Deliverables:**
- Comparative analysis document
- POC implementations of top 2-3 candidates
- Performance benchmarks
- Migration effort estimation
- Recommendation with pros/cons

**Decision Context:**
- PKG remains the primary build system until better alternative found
- NCC experiment showed it's not suitable for our use case
- Priority: Find actively maintained, future-proof solution
